Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.priority_queue

Class HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue.AdaptablePQEntry<K,​V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.priority_queue.AbstractPriorityQueue.PQEntry<K,​V>
      • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.priority_queue.HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue.AdaptablePQEntry<K,​V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of key (priority) stored in the adaptable prioriy queue entry
    V - the type of value stored in the adaptable priority queue entry
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PriorityQueue.Entry<K,​V>
    Enclosing class:
    HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue<K extends java.lang.Comparable<K>,​V>
    public static class HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue.AdaptablePQEntry<K,​V>
extends AbstractPriorityQueue.PQEntry<K,​V>
    An AdaptablePQEntry extends AbstractPriorityQueue.PQEntry to maintain a reference of the entry's current index within the array-based heap data structure. Adaptable PQ Entries must be location-aware so that the worst-case runtime of replaceKey, replaceValue, and remove are O(log n)
    Author:
    Dr. King
